intro: Lellingeria oosora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent stems. Lellingeria oosora is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in regions with limited water availability.
